content: @Sean 'S' is already bound to "sed_reset", if I'm reading this right...
ah, huh, so it is... tcl either allows multiple bindings or I had it in a different position in the list at that point in time. hm, so let's see.

I'll be darned if I didn't know there was an undocumented apply/reset command for sed mode. I'd wondered that myself why there was reject and accept commands, but not apply and reset. The bindings for the four of them make no f'ing sense to me... so inconsistent.
Okay. Well two options come to mind. Can shift it to a different modifier (likely candidate: <Control-s>) and/or retire the sed bindings since they're not documented as far as I can tell.

make that three, of course, can pick a different key like "N", which I see you did. I thought about 'N' but am leery of embedding an unintuitive command name on an action. that said, binding looks good enough for now until we can plan things out better. I may still yank the sed keys though.. they're a bit disconcerting.
